heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 24 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (213°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 5%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 333 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 3.7°C), cloud levels (up 497 m), dew point temperature (up 2.6°C), and outside temperature (up 3.7°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 332.7m lower than yesterday, 134.3m lower than the past week, 497.1m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 794m minimum and 2000m maximum, with an average of 864.5m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 998.8m and 1361.6m.
cloud levels.summary: Expect overcast skies with low cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and calm and still conditions are expected. A few light raindrops may fall, overcast skies with low cloud, and it’s dark. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
